column1: 01:06|We had come out of church together after midnight service and had immediately seen the offending light
column2: as had most of the congregation. And Bill
column4: had looked at his watch. His call to the manor had been made at six minutes past one.|The Murder of Santa Claus|P.D. James

column1: 01:06|When he woke it was 1:06 by the digital clock on the bedside table. He lay there looking at the ceiling
column2: the raw glare of the vaporlamp outside bathing the bedroom in a cold and bluish light. Like a winter moon.|No Country for Old Men|Cormac McCarthy
